page.title: 07AN INTERVIEW WITH A LORD
page.content: {Lord Cawley}talked to a group of children on the steps of{Berrington Hall.He is very proud of the house and his estates make up a large proportion of our squares,about 3,000 acres. The house itself was built in 1778 of brick covered in sandstone quarried from Moreton, just down the road. The farm employs 7 men and the gardens 2 men. Lord Cawley lives at{Bircher {Hall}now and has done so since 1973. He goes to the{House of Lords regularly and chairs a Committee hearing private bills. Since 1957 the Hall itself has been run by the {National Trust}and about 18,000 visitors a year see it. Lord Cawley's grandfather bought the estate for Â£14,500 in 1901 and furnished the house with beautiful furniture. Lord Cawley knows most of the families of Luston, some still work for him.
